name: Beach Club

reviews.title: Get away from it all
reviews.text: I visited Hamilton from the UK via Sydney and on arriving spent 3 days on a boat sailing around some of the islands. After 3 days of 'boat living' - i.e. not being able to have a decent shower, the luxury of the Beach Club was a welcome 4 days stay.

reviews.title: Heaven for the Rich
reviews.text: Its setting is perfect, and the VIP valet buggy service means you don't have to worry about hiring your own - they just take you where you want to go and pick you up at any time of the day or night.

reviews.title: Loved the Beach Club!
reviews.text: Hamilton has a harbour and restaurants and shops around it - rather than just being one hotel with its own facilities (like Haymen island). You can go out of your hotel onto the harbour and watch the world go by.

reviews.title: Steven and Michelle's Romantic Honeymoon week @ the Beach club
reviews.text: Perfect for a few days of relaxation on the beach or by the infinity pool.

reviews.title: Bit of a bizarre place
reviews.text: Highlight of the islands - taking the sea plane over the Barrier Reef and landing on Whitehaven Beach for a glass of Champagne. A must do....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Beach Club for 3 nights towards the end of April and was very impressed with everthing about the resort - the rooms were immaculate; the gardens and beach clean; and the restaurant food delicious (and good value). The owner, Mike, was extermely friendly and full of advice about the island, as were all the guests staying there. I'd highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: One of the best in Vietnam
Trangile place to stay, yummy food to taste...
reviews.text: Compared with the other resorts, the Beach Club is the closest one to the beach. Meanwhile, it is the best location for appreciating the sunset. They have an excellent chef to cook for the yummy food not only the western style but also the vientname style.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staffs are very sweet to look after every guest. They also recommend a spectacular beach to us - Bai Sao Beach, which is really a fatanstic place to enjoy sunshine, the white and soft beach.
reviews.title: Dreaming We were still there....

likes.liked: — the location and the amazing staff

reviews.title: Our little paradise
reviews.text: Last but not the least, the cost is really modest on both accommodation and meal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are planning trips to Phu Quoc, four gals highly recommeded that places as your holiday resort.
reviews.title: Excellent, relaxing place. Amazing Value

likes.disliked: — nothing. Got exactly what we expected.

reviews.title: Quite a suprise
reviews.text: We chose this hotel mainly because it seemed to be the best on the island and I must admit I still belive this to be true.

reviews.title: Near perfect
reviews.text: The rooms where typical queensland style. Nothing overly flash. The bathrooms where quite large. But realistically your not going to spend alot of time in your rooms.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: The hotel breakfast is the best weve encountered anywhere ( in this country or overseas )

reviews.title: Beach Club - hotel 4* service 3*
reviews.text: But by far the best thing we did was the degustation dinner. We had wine matched courses served to us right on the beach. The hotel sets up tables on the shore with your own personal waiter. If you consider yourself to be a 'foodie' you wont want to miss out on this one. Once again weve eaten degustations all around Australia and this one is high on our list. The setting cant be beaten by anything else.

reviews.title: As good as we expected
reviews.text: We had previously stayed on Daydream Island which failed dismally compared to Hamilton Island. If your trying to decide Hamilton trumps Daydream any day. The only thing it is lacking, which Daydream is not, is a day spa. You would think Hamilton Island or particularly the Beach Club would provide a Day spa. But maybe with the new resort set to open at the end of 2007?

reviews.title: Loved the Beach Club
reviews.text: We are curently enjoying our second last day at the Beach Club, and it has exceeded our expectations.

reviews.title: Wonderful Resort, best on Hamilton
reviews.text: We are here for a combined 50th birthday and 22nd wedding anniversary and are delighted with our choice.

reviews.title: Excellent, Romantic & Tranquil
reviews.text: I was originally going to book at Hayman Island, but was hesitant after reading some of the latest reviews.

reviews.title: Wonderful place
reviews.text: The location is magnificent (get a ground floor room if at all possible as you can walk straight onto the beach) and the staff are as friendly and helpful as other reviewers have remarked.

We had four days here in October. The food is reasonable although prices are 4 times higher than anywhere else in Vietnam as they have you captive here. Also laundry is $4.00 US a kilo, also 4 times higher than anywhere else in Vietnam. The rooms are clean and very basic (fans and cold water only unless you are in the huts that have hot water) and for $20.00 US a night it is what it is.
reviews.title: A teeny piece of clean beach in the middle of a garbage dump!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was not peaceful while we were here, the large mansion next door is being renovated and there was constant construction noise, diesel motors blowing smoke all over us right next to our deck chairs on the beach.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!

likes.liked: — the beach, the hammocks, the sunsets, the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you are driving from the aiport you realise how remote you are from anywhere. If you are off on excursions all day diving etc. it is peaceful at night to come back to, a bit too peaceful for us though. Also the beach is kept very clean directly in front of the property however 2 feet either side the rubbish is horrendous and goes for the length of the beach, we would not go back in the water after running into fluorescent light tubes, glass bottles and light globes that littered the water. It may be nice to see the livestock appear on the beach, however they use the sand as their bathroom...not pleasant.
reviews.title: A Great Getaway!

likes.liked: — Sang! It is s super friendly, very clean and so cosy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The young lady managing it is great (as is the young man), however when she is out the staff lay around in the hammocks and the local ladies peddling their massages take over the beach lounges, not a good look. Maybe Mike should pop in unannounced once in a while.
reviews.title: Beach Club was great!

likes.disliked: — A bit far out of town.

reviews.text: There are better choices that Beach Club, do your homework.
reviews.title: A peaceful getaway with beautiful sunsets

likes.disliked: — No internet access and the nearest internet cafe is 4 kms away!

reviews.title: Fantastic Hospitality Wondrful Location
reviews.text: 8 off us, 4 in out 40's, 3 late teens and a 12 year old, stayed at the Beach Club for 7 nights in July.

description: With its absolute beachfront location, the Beach Club offers the ultimate romantic island holiday experience. Set in landscaped gardens, all 57 rooms face directly onto Catseye Beach, each with theirown private courtyard or balcony. Exclusive room inclusions/ A la carte breakfast daily at the Beach Club restaurant / VIP return Hamilton Island airport/marina to Beach Club transfers / VIP chauffeur service / Use of catamarans, paddle skis, windsurfers and snorkellingequipment / Use of the gym, spa and sauna / Tennis and squash court hire / Use of the Beach Club lounge, pool and restaurant. Note: Beach Club does not cater for persons under the age of 18 years
